turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: How--how much do you want for the Mickey Mantle, rookie season?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I was thinking of selling all the cards.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Really? No kidding?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: See, my problem is, all I have are hundred dollar bills and I need something smaller.  Ones, fives, tens. Like that.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I see what ya mean. Tell you what...I'll give you five hundred dollars in small bills for the whole box.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Oh, that would be wonderful!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well, we're here to help!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Sir? I would really appreciate it if you wouldn't take the Lord's name in vain again.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh, you got a problem with that?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I didn't want to leave without saying how much I admire your jewelry.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Hey, smart ass, how 'bout I kick your butt?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Oh. A nice one, I hope.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Yes, ma'am.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Elbows, Son.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Sorry, Mom!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: You never know. You may someday dine at the White House with the president.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Dad!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Oh, no! Oh, my goodness!   Let's get him into the bedroom.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: He seems to be doing all right now.  I don't know if he's had a heart attack or just... a horrifying experience. But we  need supplies and I've got to stay with him.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I'll go up.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I'm afraid you've got to.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I'll be all right.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: You're my brave boy.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I don't know how far you'll have to travel to find supplies, but if you can't get home by nightfall, I want you to look for something called a Holiday Inn. Write that down. It's a hotel. There might still be one standing.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Yes, ma'am.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I just hope this is still good up there.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Mom?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I was thinking that, uh...you know, while I was up there and all...that maybe I could, you know...try to meet a girl.  I've, been thinking about that a little...just these last...fifteen years or so.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Oh, Adam,that would be wonderful if you could find a girl. One who's not a mutant...and hopefully comes from Pasadena. Nothing against Valley girls, but in my day anyhow, the girls from Pasadena, I don't know...always just seemed a little nicer.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Yes, ma'am.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Here's the shopping list and $3,000 which should take care of everything.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Yes, ma'am.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Your father has a few final words for you. You know, he'd fight a buzz saw for you - he loves you so much. We both do.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Heck, I know that mom! You're my parents.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: ...and his church group have volunteered to help us bring the supplies down.  But we've got to hurry.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Are you in trouble, son?!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I think I'm being chased by a psychiatrist.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: A psychiatrist?!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Mom?  Eve and I have to go.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I can't explain it now.  But I want you to set the locks for two months. You have more than enough of everything.  Then we'll be back to get you.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: We have to go.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: No, wait! At least stay for dinner!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: This is your bedroom?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: No, Mom, I've turned it into Dad's office.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Well, where are you --

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Eve and I...eloped.  We're married.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Oh, my God!

turns.speaker: ARON
turns.text: He'll catch him.  Hi. This is Nina Aron.  I've got a run away and I'm going to need police assistance.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: No!  Not the police!  Don't call them!

turns.speaker: ARON
turns.text: I have to. If a complaint is made and the person resists obser--

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: No, I can't have that! They'll come with their cars and their guns and their handcuffs--

turns.speaker: ARON
turns.text: Calm down, please. This man needs help and you need protection from him. That's obvious.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: You know, I don't think so. I'm confused but you know, I don't think he'd ever hurt me. I don't think he'd hurt anyone.

turns.speaker: ARON
turns.text: And now you must let me be the judge of that!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I was frightened and I didn't know what to think! But you know-I believe him. I think he just wants to go home. Wherever the hell that is...

turns.speaker: ARON
turns.text: Let's all remain calm. That's the key thing.

turns.speaker: LEVY
turns.text: According to Caltech, this Webber guy was a bonafide genius and a borderline nutcase.

turns.speaker: ATKINSON
turns.text: Well, he and Mrs. Nutcase must have been out here when the plane hit.

turns.speaker: LEVY
turns.text: Unless we get a postcard or somethin', that's my guess.

turns.speaker: ATKINSON
turns.text: What about relatives?

turns.speaker: LEVY
turns.text: All back East.

turns.speaker: ATKINSON
turns.text: The neighbors over there said the guy spent day and night out here. She'd bring him sandwiches and hot Dr. Pepper.

turns.speaker: LEVY
turns.text: He drank it hot?

turns.speaker: ATKINSON
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: LEVY
turns.text: Good god.

turns.speaker: ATKINSON
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: STREET WALKER
turns.text: You got a light, honey?

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: What?!  A light!  Yes, I've got a light!

turns.speaker: STREET WALKER
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: So...you...survived the blast, did you?

turns.speaker: STREET WALKER
turns.text: The blast?  Honey, I have survived a host of things. Like the song says: "A country boy can survive!"

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Yes, yes, the song.  So tell me...has it been...hell up here?

turns.speaker: STREET WALKER
turns.text: "Hell up here?"  Honey, it's been hell up here, down there and over yonder! Hell everywhere.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Yes, I can tell that just looking around.  "Boy?"  Did you say you were a "country boy?"

turns.speaker: STREET WALKER
turns.text: Cute Little Old Man, if you want a boy, I can be a boy.  And if you want a girl, I can be a girl.  I can be anything you want me to be!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: STREET WALKER
turns.text: Uh-huh. And it's all yours for the remarkably low price of only $200! And if you act now, I might even throw in some free lawn furniture.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: No, I can't.  I'm sorry!  I have to go!  I have to...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: For Pete's sake, Calvin!  We've got guests!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Sorry, honey!  I just got to fooling with this darn rheostat.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Well, put it down and come in!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: You bet, hon!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: I'm sorry everyone, but given this extraordinary turn of events, I think it's prudent that we cut the evening short. I'm sure this Cuban thing will resolve itself, but in the meantime...I'd suggest taking a prayerful watch-and-wait stance!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: We'll do this again! Maybe next week. Here's your hat. Could I wrap something up for you? Did you have a coat?

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: It's time.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Time? Oh, no Calvin. It's not time yet. I still have--

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: It shuts off automatically.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Did you rig it to do that? You're so clever.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: No.  They all do.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I never know anymore.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: You hear that?!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Calvin, I wish you would have at least let me do the dishes. It's not going to be that easy getting all that dried- on food off my nice plates.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: I just hope those plates aren't radioactive by tomorrow morning.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Cheese is particularly troublesome.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Worse than your Kraft Holiday dip?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Oh, much worse. But not as bad as that Mexican Jumping Bean dip. You remember that?

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Yeah, yeah. Okay.  Give me the roast and watch your step.  I'll come back for the radio.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: How long will we have to stay down here?

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: I don't know. For this thing to blow over, it could take days.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Days??

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Rather safe than sorry. That's my motto!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: But, what if I go into labor? That could happen any time.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: I've read up on it. I'll deliver the baby myself if I have to.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Now you listen to me Calvin Webber, when this baby comes, you're going to be out in the waiting room smoking yourself to death with all the other fathers.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Yes, dear!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: As long as we've got that straight.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Home sweet home!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: To you maybe.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What's that noise?

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: The locks.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: The locks?

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: To keep us from trying to leave. After an atomic blast there's a radiation half-life that lasts thirty five years.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Thirty -five years!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Then after that it's safe.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: It's safe.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: To go up.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: To go up.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Hi, honey! Feeling better?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: We have to be strong, sweetheart. If not for ourselves, for the child.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: All our friends...

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Burnt to a crisp.  I've given you the most well-done cut.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I'm not hungry.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Hot Dr. Pepper! Your favorite!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: No, Calvin, you're favorite.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Maybe I've just got the creeps.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: How could you?! This is just like home!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: No. No! Calvin, this is different! Believe me!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Would you like a tranquilizer?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: You have tranquilizers?

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: I told you! I've got everything!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Oh, no.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Uh, oh. Now it's time.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Honey?

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Is there a problem?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: No, Calvin.  Babies cry.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: I've noticed.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What shall we call him?

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: No.  I think it's just right.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: And I was wondering...if...if I could have a...

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: If I...you know...

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: What? Whatever you want, Helen!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Calvin?!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Right here!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: We looked all over for you. What are you doing back here?

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Oh, I was just examining this rear hatchway.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: No reason.  Well, it's pretty clear that the front entrance caved in when the bomb went off. So, you know, when the time is up, we'll have to return to the surface using, you know, this back entrance.  Which is very nice because it has the service elevator!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Very nice. Unless it caved in, too.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Yes.  Well... yes.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Watch this!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Not bad for a three and a half year old! I'd like to see the public school system match that! I don't care how terrific it is!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Yes, he's very bright, dear. Much like his father. But you know, Calvin, maybe he's a little...young for school.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Nonsense. People have no idea what the human mind is capable of. Look at us!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Yes, you certainly will. And you'll find a nice girl and rebuild America. Just the way it used to be.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Oh, Calvin, I'm not sure we should be making promises that perhaps can't be kept.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: I believe there will be other survivors. In fact, I'm guessing there's life on the surface, even now. It's not life worth living perhaps, but believe me, something's moving around up there. And I don't just mean the cockroaches.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Hi, honey!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Calvin!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Coming!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Get the presents and do the lights.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: You bet.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: No kidding.  Who else would have done it?

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: And I made these!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What did you wish for, Adam?

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: If he tells, it won't come true!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Oh, that's just a bunch of baloney! We never believed that in my family!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Well, we did in my family!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: One who doesn't glow in the dark.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Calvin Webber! What a thing to say!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Well, we'll be going up in two years. We'll know then. I'm very hopeful.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Let's eat our cake.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Yeah. Let's dig in!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: If we still have one.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: You know, when we do go up...I'm going to miss this old place. How 'bout you, hon?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Would you excuse me?

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: In the generator room again?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Oh, yes.  It just fascinates me how all    these things work.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: I know exactly what you mean!  Hey, honey?

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Should we say a little prayer first?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Just open the door.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Yes, yes it is!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: It's an archaic colloquialism, roughly meaning..."good".

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Yes! That's right!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: I'm going to give it to you straight. There's no point in beating around the bush. There were survivors. Apparently, the fallout has created....a subspecies of mutants.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Mutants?!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: It's not a pretty sight. Some eat out of garbage cans.  Others are...cover your ears, Son, and hum.  I mean that literally and I mean right now!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Others are...multi-sexual.  It seems...they can be both masculine and feminine...simultaneously.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I don't believe it!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: They've done a lot of re-building but society, at least as we knew it, has utterly collapsed. People throw up in the streets. Others point guns. There's something terribly wrong with the automobiles and...and I...I can't tell you the rest.  I just can't.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Oh my. Oh,my, oh my, oh, my. So, what do we do now?

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: We stay down here.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: We do?

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Excuse me.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: For how long?  We've just about run out of everything!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: We'll make do.  I'm of the opinion that these mutants will eventually kill each other off and then--

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: No, Calvin.  We're not going to make do.  Not me!  Not Adam.  We're going up no matter what!  We deserve it. Even if it's terrible!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Well, I am the head of this household--

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I want him to at least see the sky!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: --and we will--

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: And the ocean!  A mountain range!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: --do as I say!

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: He's smart.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Yes, dear, I know.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: And Lord we ask finally that you send an angel to look after and protect our beloved son, Adam.  Amen.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Amen.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: How long will you set it for this time?

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: I thought ten years.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Well, that's...considerably shorter than before.  I was wondering, Calvin, why set the locks at all.  I mean the radiation is gone and...

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: To keep what's up there from getting down here! It's not the radiation I'm worried about.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Well, please excuse us!  We...we haven't entertained a guest in...um...

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Some time.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What can I offer you, Eve?

turns.speaker: CLIFF
turns.text: What are you bitching about now?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: CLIFF
turns.text: I forgot some of my stuff.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Your stuff?  Let me see that.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: You came back for these?

turns.speaker: CLIFF
turns.text: Hey, they're Ralph Laurens.  And who's this interesting looking fellow?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: This is Adam.  Adam, meet Cliff.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Go home, Cliff, wherever that might be.

turns.speaker: CLIFF
turns.text: Shana Gillroy's apartment.  Remember her?  The model who went to Harvard? Well, I better get going!  Bye, Adam. Nice coat!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: So where is your roommate, the model?

turns.speaker: CLIFF
turns.text: You know, I don't know.  And looking at you, I don't care.  It's been too long, Eve.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Go home, Adam.  Go to your hotel.

turns.speaker: CLIFF
turns.text: Yeah. Before I kick your ass.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Stop it, you two!

turns.speaker: CLIFF
turns.text: I guess we shouldn't fight in here.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Eve!  This guy is un-be-liev-able!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I knew you'd like him.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Darlin', this is X-File stuff!  Think about it!  The guy's got all this easily negotiable property. He's obviously setting something up very big.  Like a self-sustaining island off the coast of South America, for instance. Or perhaps he's the head of a cult that's doing weird things with poultry and pipe tobacco. I've heard worse.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: So, Adam...where on earth are you from?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Out-of-town.  That's all he'll say.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Since that guy rear-ended me in Palm Springs.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Oh, yes.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I even guessed his hotel, didn't I?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Give me your hand.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Oh, my God...

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: But first, you have to start with the clothes!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Exactly.  You understand that, don't you?  You have no chance of meeting a woman dressed like that.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Money is no object.  He's got cards up the wazoo.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: You're serious, aren't you?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: What's that supposed to mean?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: It means that your taste in men's apparel is as bad as your taste in men.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Well, that's blunt!

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: I'm sorry. But if the shoe fits.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: And I suppose you see him in some sort of strapless  thing, don't you?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: I see "elegant."

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Yeah? Like Ralph Lauren?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: That's what I'm sensing.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Alright, I will.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I'm busy tomorrow anyway. I have to buy six thousand paper napkins.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: What do you think, Adam?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Well, what do you think?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I think...it...works.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Let me show you the entire trousseau!

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: How 'bout it, Eve? Can he skate around your block?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: That water's freezing!

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: He's from Alaska.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Just be yourself.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Always good advice.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: For him. It doesn't work for the rest of us.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Are you kidding?!  You wouldn't even be a crumb on her table!  You don't see that?!

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Eve?!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Well, I'm trying to educate him!  It's nothing personal.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Adam,  I think for you, we should go for "sweet."

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Um... Eve?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: It's not so much what you say but how you say it.  Women like men who are unpredictable.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Go to the bathroom.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Right here?  Well, you're being so bossy I wasn't sure!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: He go back to the hotel?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Uh..he might of.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: What's that mean?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: We did not leave together.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Who did he leave with?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: What's it to you?!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I'm his pimp. He left with the dancers, didn't he?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Hey, you're the psychic. Eve, the psychic pimp.  You tell me.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Those sluts!

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Yeah. But who's not a slut these days?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: To bed.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: To bed?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Yeah.  I'm not the one who's in love with the guy.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: What?!  Now hold on!  Wait one damn minute!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: In the first place, I don't fall in love with weirdos I've only known for four or five days.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Yes, you do.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: And I don't fall in love with grown men who collect baseball cards!!

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Uh, yes, you do.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Or pee in their pants when they see the ocean!

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Yes, you do!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Or have perfect table manners.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: You know, I asked him about that. And he said that good manners are a way we have of showing other people that we respect them. See, you'd eat like a slob if you were alone, but since another human being is present, you show that person respect by going to the trouble of having proper manners. I didn't know that. I thought it was a way of appearing superior.  Know what else he told me?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: He thinks that I am a gentleman and that you are a lady!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Well, consider the source. I don't even know what a lady is.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Exactly! I thought a gentleman was somebody who owned horses. Turns out, the short and very simple definition of a gentleman or a lady is: someone who always attempts to make the people around him or her feel as comfortable as possible. That's it! If you don't do that, nothing else matters. The cars, the clothes, the houses...

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Where did he get all that information?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: From the oddest place. His parent's told him. I don't think I got that memo.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: So now I suppose he's trying to make those two dancers feel as comfortable as possible.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: He didn't leave with them.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Well...I admit it. I'm glad to hear that.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: He left with Sophie.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: What?!!

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: It's true.  She swept him out the door whispering little French things into his ear.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Oh, no! Not Sophie! No way! Please don't tell me that!!

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: What are you going to do? Go over to her place and kick in the door?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: You're goddamn right I am!

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Coward!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Well what was I supposed to do?! He wants me to live underground with him! That's like Silence of the Lambs, don't you think?!

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: I know...I know. You did the right thing.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Oh, no!

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Gay.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Oh.  Well, you're...certainly welcome!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Good God...you don't think there really is a bomb shelter, do you?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Fallout shelter.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: What do you want to do with it?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Give it back to him.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: And if we can't find him?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: We'll find him.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: I don't know.  Everything's so neat. It's all just so...goddamn dear.  Damn!

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: See these?  Found them in the box with the cards.  These are stock certificates.  IBM.  AT&T.  Polaroid.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Millions upon millions upon millions! The cards. The stock!  The clothes! The toothpaste!  The guy was on the level!  And you blew it!  A man walks into your life who is the kindest, most polite, honest, trustworthy, incredibly rich guy you have ever met in your life!! And what do you do?!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Have him committed.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Yeah! That's thinking.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: He was always so "nice"! How was I supposed to know that's a good thing?! "Nice" is weird! Nice is...what is "nice"? It's not cool! I'll tell you that.  Was it ever?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: I don't know. I like to think so.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Well, at least I fell for him before I found out he was rich! That's new.  Wait a minute! He said today he knew where home was. What happened this morning?! Where did you go?!

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: To get some frozen poultry.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Then what?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: We came back to the house!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: You didn't stop anywhere else?!

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: No. No, wait a minute. We stopped at a porno store.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: An adult bookstore. He was very excited about seeing it. You think home is under a dirty bookstore in the Valley?

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Why would you put a fallout shelter under a porno shop?

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: None of this stuff was here in 1962. The Valley was mostly small homes and fruit orchards.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Well, we've come a long way, haven't we?  I want to go home.

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Yeah.  Maybe he'll call.

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Adam!!

turns.speaker: TROY
turns.text: Where?!

turns.speaker: EVE
turns.text: Stop!
